channel.title: Astral travel
channel.description: What do you think about astral travel/projection, have you had any experiences related to that? Do you even think its possible? Discuss

item.title: Astral travel
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:14, topic:538771”]If you are talking about the same activity that happens in the movie ‘Insidious’, then I believe the perception of it is real, or the feeling of it occurring, but I don’t believe that it is physically (spiritually?) possible to extract oneself from the body.[/quote]By saying that im assumming that you believe that we have souls right?

Read full topic

item.title: Astral travel
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

If you are talking about the same activity that happens in the movie ‘Insidious’, then I believe the perception of it is real, or the feeling of it occurring, but I don’t believe that it is physically (spiritually?) possible to extract oneself from the body.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral travel
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:12, topic:538771”][quote author=t4 link=topic=657600.msg4400784#msg4400784 date=1390590023]

I do not believe it is real at all. All you need to do is take some strong psychedelics to know just how crazy your brain can construct reality. They are achieving this through other means (meditation etc) I believe the sensations are 100% real. I do not believe the spirituality aspect behind it. (astral body, astral plane, etc)

There’s other explanations for these experiences.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Out-of-body_experience#Theories_of_OBEs

This, I recently had an experience using said methodology. I take into account the spiritual aspect, but only reflecting on life and meaning in juxtaposition to the universe.
[/quote]
Which methodology? Psychedelics?[/quote]
Mhm.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral travel
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:9, topic:538771”][quote author=jme link=topic=657600.msg4399266#msg4399266 date=1390148851]

@jme, and may i ask, what are you thoughts on lucid dreaming

Well lucid dreaming is becoming aware that you are dreaming. It is different from dream control but an important step. I used to practice it when I was younger, but woke up in excitement anytime I became lucid.

Great community to get started: http://www.dreamviews.com/
[/quote]And what can you really do in a lucid dream? i mean, you just become aware and do wathever you want? Or can you control anything…?
And thanks for that url i might check it later:)[/quote]
I had one experience with Lucid dreaming so I will try explain my best how it is.
I was in my backyard and then suddenly I became aware that I was dreaming (I practised it by asking everytime I did something, am i dreaming or is this real?) Now when I realised I was dreaming I was really excited and yea I just thought of something and it was happening like if you think about flying you will find yourself flying :d it is really cool but strange and short aswell.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral travel
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:

@jme, and may i ask, what are you thoughts on lucid dreaming
[/quote]

Well lucid dreaming is becoming aware that you are dreaming. It is different from dream control but an important step. I used to practice it when I was younger, but woke up in excitement anytime I became lucid.

Great community to get started: http://www.dreamviews.com/[/quote]And what can you really do in a lucid dream? i mean, you just become aware and do wathever you want? Or can you control anything…?
And thanks for that url i might check it later:)

Read full topic

item.title: Astral travel
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Strucker:

@jme, and may i ask, what are you thoughts on lucid dreaming

Well lucid dreaming is becoming aware that you are dreaming. It is different from dream control but an important step. I used to practice it when I was younger, but woke up in excitement anytime I became lucid.

Great community to get started: http://www.dreamviews.com/

item.title: Astral travel
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I agree with jme, the brain is powerful enough to make a person believe anything at all.

“What is real? How do you define ‘real’? If you’re talking about what you can feel, what you can smell, what you can taste and see, then ‘real’ is simply electrical signals interpreted by your brain.”

Read full topic
